name: Small stature and large weapons: exceptions?
author: Aquarius 233

posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
Hi all!
It's my second playthrough of the Swordflight series, and I've played it with a gnome spellsword.
Now, as we all know, the small stature implies that:
Because they are so small, they cannot use the following weapons: dire mace, two-bladed sword, double axe, greataxe, greatsword, halberd, heavy flail, quarterstaff, scythe, and spear.  (Nwnwiki)
Today I obtained a powerful halberd, and I was preparing to sell it...but...I noticed that if I selected the item, the game showed only a white halo, and not a red halo.....could it be that my small gnome could wield, with his own hands, the big bad halberd?

Of course she does!




I quickly went to the smithy and I discovered that the same can be applied for a spear, hence these weapons seem an exception (not mentioned in the wiki).



Is that a bug in the game? I tried to search somewhere in this new and the old ecb guilds, but found nothing...

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Thou art a miracle, Aquarius! Either that, or RogueKnight decided to make some adaptations, and I couldn't attest to that one way or another - others may know better.

Cool screenshots though!

posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
Ahah, yes, a miracle! 😄
I think that it's not a change RogueKnight has made. That's because my little Nathee, at the really beginning of the original campaign (gave it a try now), when you have to buy your weapon, there is a white/fading green halo on both the halberd and the spear.
Bought the two of them and she can handle them, of course with both hands. 🙂

It would be perfect if someone could confirm it, but on the basis of all the evidence it seems that there are really exceptions to the weapons that can't be wielded by little creatures.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Hmm, now I'm intrigued as well - come on, you clever buggers, has Aquarius stumbled upon a Gnome without equal, or is there a more mundane explanation? (I so want it to be that Nathee is special, btw.)

posts.author: grom56
posts.content: This is interesting...   I run a few Halflings and have never noticed this with regards to spears or halberds.   I'll have to check it out on WoG next time and let you all know...

posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
Thank you very much, Grom! This can shed some light upon this matter.
Now that I remember, I haven't done any check on exotic weapons: maybe the bastard sword and the katana (the only exotic weapons wielded with one hand by medium size people) can be grabbed by gnomes and halflings with two hands...

The weapons normally handled with two-hands by humans, elves, etc. can't surely be used by gnomes and halflings...

posts.author: grom56
posts.content: Looking over the list you post from NWNWiKI that you posted, neither Bastard sword or Katana is on it.   Looks like they are usable by small folk.  Here's a tidbit that holds true at least over on WoG:  While Quarterstaffs are not usable by Halflings and Gnomes, Magic Staffs are.  I guess because your not supposed to be hitting folks with your Magic Staff??

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: Magic staffs are medium sized weapons. Humans and other medium sized creatures can wield them together with a shield.

posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content: Just a question: with the halberd now usable with a small sized creature, would you prefer to use it or, instead, a scimitar for more frequent crits? it's a trade-off: better average damage vs more frequent crits.

posts.author: MrZork
posts.content:
I just tested this in the OC Prelude (vanilla) and a gnome with martial proficiency could not equip a halberd. Either someone was playing with baseitems.2da or otherwise being creative with some other settings. But, without such tweaking, a small creature shouldn't be able to equip a large weapon.

(Note that making custom weapons of other sizes is quite possible. For instance, CEP has a tiny spear that is  a medium weapon, usable small creatures as a two-handed weapon.)

posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
MrZork, thank you very much for your contribution!
I don't know why the game showed the halberd as playable by my gnome (I have tried disabling the patch haks loaded into the game, and still the issue persists). However, I won't ever use it with a little character (it's been a while that it is in my inventory, not used, but ready for it), in order to play fairly (the only thing that matters to me). The same is valid for spears.

posts.author: MrZork
posts.content: Don't misunderstand me: If the module has added content to alter the weapon settings, there is nothing unfair about using them. I do understand your desire to play the module the way it was intended, so as not to undermine the challenges the module creator designed. I haven't played the module you mention, so I can't say whether what you are seeing was intended or not.
